slides.title: Why Queues? ‚è≥
slides.content:
# Async Processing

Some tasks take too long for a web request (sending emails, processing videos).

Queues let you offload this work to the background, returning a fast response to the user immediately.

slides.title: Drivers
slides.content:
# Storage üíæ

Where are jobs stored?

- **sync:** Runs immediately (for dev).
- **database:** Stores in DB table.
- **redis:** Super fast (Production standard).
- **sqs:** AWS Simple Queue Service.

slides.title: Creating Jobs
slides.content:
# The Unit of Work üì¶

`php artisan make:job ProcessPodcast`

Generates a class with a `handle()` method where you put your logic.

`ProcessPodcast::dispatch($podcast);`

slides.title: Running the Worker
slides.content:
# The Processor ‚öôÔ∏è

You need a process running in the background to pick up jobs.

`php artisan queue:work`

It polls the queue and executes jobs one by one.

slides.title: Horizon
slides.content:
# Dashboard üìä

Beautiful dashboard for Redis queues.

Monitor throughput, runtime, and failures in real-time.

Easily configure how many workers process each queue.

slides.title: Job Retries
slides.content:
# Resilience üîÑ

If a job fails (API down), Laravel can retry it automatically.

`public $tries = 3;`

After 3 failures, it goes to the `failed_jobs` table.

slides.title: Task Scheduling
slides.content:
# Cron üï∞Ô∏è

Execute commands periodically (e.g., Daily Report).

`$schedule->command('emails:send')->daily();`

Defined in `app/Console/Kernel.php`.

slides.title: Events & Listeners
slides.content:
# Decoupling üß©

Fire an event: `OrderShipped`.

Listeners react: `SendEmail`, `UpdateInventory`, `NotifySlack`.

Listeners can be queued automatically!

slides.title: Batches
slides.content:
# Grouping üß∫

Execute a batch of jobs and perform an action when ALL of them are finished.

`Bus::batch([...])->then(...)`

slides.title: Delayed Dispatch
slides.content:
# Wait for it ‚úã

Send an email 10 minutes from now.

`ProcessPodcast::dispatch($podcast)->delay(now()->addMinutes(10));`

slides.title: Failure Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Where does a job go if it fails all its retry attempts?
quizOptions: It goes back to the main queue
It goes to the failed_jobs table

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Queues ‚è≥

Async power.

- **Jobs:** Tasks.
- **Workers:** Processors.
- **Horizon:** Monitor.
- **Scheduler:** Cron replacement.
- **Events:** Decoupled reactions.
